p: The pharmacological activity of S. scardica is attributed to the high content of flavonoid and phenolic compounds. Studies have demonstrated that plants from the Sideritis genus have antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, diuretic, antibacterial, analgesic, and antifungal effects [ 86]. In experimental ex vivo models, S. scardica showed a capacity to inhibit human serotonin transporter (hSERT) greater than in rat models [ 77]. Accordingly, the in vivo test in rats showed that S. scardica extract administered orally has been associated with psychostimulant and antidepressive effects, being classified as perhaps a substitute for adaptogens and thus useful for other pathologies correlated with depressive or altered mental status like sleep apnea or increased cardiovascular risks [ 87â€“ 89].
